content.description: Start at about the same spot as Silver Bullet. A slabby face gains into a left-facing vertical crack. You can continue the slabby face to the right of the crack for a delicate 5.10 that feels similar to Bite The Bullet nearbyOften dirty and needs a regular scrubbing
content.location: Head to the bottom of Silver Bullet Bluff. Look for the shallow dihedral of Silver Bullet on the right side of the main prow. Start at about the same spot as Silver Bullet.

content.description: An obvious arete paired with a beautiful left-ward curving cracks running parallel to a slabby face
content.location: From the bottom, look for the #6 sign on the tree. This climb is found on the corner before you approach that tree.From above, continue the trail downward past Glenn's route, heading down and leftwards along the rock. Past Centurion, this will be just around the corner on the left.

content.description: climb up decent edges to the top. no anchor.
content.location: left angling crack just to the left of Superman. Very little gear. Best TR'd off the tree above.

content.description: Fun little shallow corner climb on the upper tier left
content.location: Upper left tier (above most of the other climbs at silver bullet bluff and to the left of the descent trail to them

content.description: Starts on a slab up to a shallow right-facing corner. Finish up on the ledge with the chain anchors
content.protection: Pro to 1" and poorly protected. Chain anchors up top for a toprope setup.
content.location: Start at the tree stump in the middle of the wall. Then move about 10 feet right until you spot the corner to the right of the thin crack that is Jack of Hearts. This will be a fair bit to the right of the rightmost chain anchors.Often mossy, which needs regular cleaning

content.description: crack to horizontal cracks.. more of a chip route than crack climbing, though. easy 5.9
content.protection: chains at top.. good protection to 1.5-2"
content.location: route starts at the tree on the right on the lower ledge on the SE end of silver bullet bluff.. directly to the right of Sundance Kid. ends at the chains directly above.

content.description: Starts at the same spot as Midnight Warrior, but uses the right face. Work the fractured right-facing feature until you reach the finger crack, just above a downward facing crescent flake. The money is in the finishing moves up that crack top out on the ledge
content.location: Between Midnight Warrior and Superman, there is a offset face with a downward facing crescent moon. This climb leads into that feature and through a finger crack to the top.

content.description: This is the dirty crack to the left of Gunsmoke. TR from the tree below Panama Red
Nice finger locks lead up the obvious corner.  Some suspicious blocks up high, careful where you protect.  Decent warm up and easy to access the chains above Fandango.
content.protection: Pro to 1", small TCUs were helpful.
content.location: The obvious corner right of Fandango

content.description:
a fun crack climb with a overhang blocky section. a final push over a bulge gets to the top.  not as good of a climb as Fandango but still quality

 there are two old, but good anchors bolts that you can walk to (or rap to. safety first) from the big ledge, easy to set up and rap down from as well, if a bit sketch.

 this climb doesn't get a lot of traffic but most of the holds were moss free and the crack was clean. we did some brushing and moss removal. would recommend standard issue RB wisk broom.

 the book gives Last Tango a .10a rating, which i will post and let you all debate. all i am going to say is that nearby Mind Games is also rated a 10.a and is much harder

 as a side note. we linked through the fandango anchors as well (easy scramble around boulder) so we could TR both routes. rope drag was manageable.

 if leading. takes good pro to 1". small nuts and cams.  maybe a 2" for the top.  pro is plentiful. 

 good climb on a good wall
content.protection: takes good pro to 1". small nuts and cams.  maybe a 2" for the top.  pro is plentiful. 2 bolts with some rusty steel oval screw links.
content.location: climb starts at vertical finger crack (Technical), 10' climber left of Fandango.  climb up into the corner crack(easy) and then up and out and over the blocky section (strenuous). a few desperate feels around the dirty, sloped top out, before pulling up to the anchors. lower or walk off left to big ledge.  a small scramble will take you to top (called approach trail in Olson's book)

content.description:
This is a decent 5.9 crack that would be a lot better if the crack didn't end 20ft. below the top.  The upper section is a bit akward and the anchors aren't placed all that well, but the botom half of the climb makes up for it. 

  Like the other routes on this cliff it's better left as a toprope.
content.protection: Gear to 1", bolts with chains at the top makes for an easy toprope setup.
content.location: Start at the tree in the middle of the wall, just to the right of the bullet-scarred face.

content.description: Left-facing corner inside the curved arete with a vertical crack
content.protection: Tree anchor 10-15 feet back from the top
content.location: From the bottom, look for the #6 sign on the tree. This climb is found is on the corner before you approach that tree.From above, continue the trail downward past Glenn's route, heading down and leftwards along the rock. Past Centurion, this will be just around the corner on the left.

content.description: Start in the big groove on the left of the wall. Climb up through a little overhanging section with some flared pods for holds, then go up the face and finish out on a juggy headwall.
content.location: Left side of main lower face

climbs.name: Glenn's Route
climbs.fa: Glenn Collier, Bill Coe, John Frieh

content.description:
3 bolts, just to the right of Superman crack which you see in Peters pic. 

  Alt direct straight up start 5.11 to clip bolt #1.
content.protection: 3 bolts, ends at 2 stainless chains on top.

content.description: Interesting climbing to a crux 3/4 of the way up involving either a deadpoint to a jug, or an interesting layback with a heelhook to do it statically. Best line I've climbed on Silver Bullet.
content.protection: Anchor with chains at a ledge at the top which can be accessed from above using a single bolt to safely obtain the anchor ledge (setup a fixed line?).
content.location: Furthest right, obvious, line on the main bluff (before the wall turns 90 degrees).

content.description: A right diagonal crack is the obvious feature here. Work this along with the other avilable crack and the face until you get to some juggy fractured ledges to finish up.There are variations if you work the area to the left of the crack
content.location: This sits just above Midnight Warrior. If you take the path to the bottom of Video Bluff and head right towards the top of the Western Silver Bullet Bluff climbs, it'll be straight in front of you

climbs.name: Centurion
climbs.fa: FFA July 1987 by Wayne Wallace & Bob McGown

content.description: Centurion is the last climb on the wall as the hill drops off. Not a bad finger crack but it is awfully short and a little dirty.
content.protection: Nuts & cams to 1/2”. No fixed anchor. One can either use a tree or cut over to the Glenn’s Route anchor.

content.description: Starts on a big pullup into a wide fractured crack. Continue along a sloping ledge up to left facing hand crack to finish the top half
content.location: Walk up the cliffside and past the anchors for Panama Red and Sundance Kid, towards the Trivial Wall. Before you reach the rightward bend, you should see a single set of anchors.

content.description: Does it count as 'chipping' if you're climbing bullet holes?  Someone went to town on this face with a rifle or a big handgun, and the chips that were taken out by the bullets comprise all the holds on the face.  Still, the sloping dishes make for some fun face climbing even if it isn't at all natural.
content.protection: 5 bolts and small cams for Jack of Heart finish. Can be easily top-roped.
content.location: Start at the tree that's snugged up to the base of the wall.

content.description:
A 50ft. cliff section with easy access for topropes on tree anchors or chain anchors. The routes are OK but certainly nothing to write home about. A good area for lower grade climbs with easy access to anchors

 The amount of trash on ground-level routes like "Bite The Bullet" fluctuates. Homeless encampments near the highway chain link fence come and go frequently
